Through this course, learn to assess a countryâs macroeconomic situation utilizing practical tools that will help you engage in day-to-day macroeconomic analysis.

Topics
------

SDG

SDG8: Decent work and economic growth Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all

SDG17: Partnerships for the goals Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development

SDG 17: Finance

Subject

Economics and Finance

Keywords

data analysis

economic

economic development

macroeconomics

In this online course on Macroeconomic Diagnostics (MDSx), you will learn some applied tools that will allow you to assess the economic situation in a country. These analytical tools are the ones most used by applied macroeconomistsâincluding those at the IMF. You will learn both how to technically implement these tools and to interpret their results.

The course will guide you through the different sectors of an economy. It will present tools to assess the relevant sector and its vulnerabilities. These applied tools will be simple to apply and they will bring out the critical information that an economist needs to make an assessment.

Beyond the tools themselves, weâll also be showing how to refine and interpret their output. We will be doing more than just plugging numbers into a spreadsheet formula. We will want to use the results of these tools â filtered through our judgement â to develop a narrative of a countryâs economic situation.

To help you make this course more hands-on, you will be examining a case study country called âDiagnostica.â We will run through a series of sector-by-sector assessments. Along the way, we will be demonstrating how to apply the diagnostic by using different country examples. Then, you will be asked to perform that same exercise and interpret it for âDiagnostica.â Finally, weâll be integrating our sectoral assessments into a comprehensive analysis known as a ârisk assessment matrixâ or RAM. This will give us a sense of where the major risks and weaknesses lie in Diagnosticaâs macroeconomic picture.

Macroeconomic Diagnostics is offered by the IMF with financial support from the Government of Japan.

Target Audience
---------------

This course is open to government officials and the general public.

Learning Objectives
-------------------

*   How to analyze potential output and calculate output gaps, identify expenditure composition of growth, measure inflation, and assess sources of inflation
*   How to assess the stance of monetary and fiscal policy and interpret financial sector soundness and risk indicators
*   How to analyze public and external debt sustainability, analyze the external position, and evaluate possible exchange rate misalignment
*   How to assess the mediumâterm prospects of the economy including the sustainability of public and external debt, and identify impediments to longâterm growth

The Power of Innovation and Design Thinking in Implementing the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development
=======================================================================================================

Microlearning

Blog

UN Partner

Offered by
----------

United Nations System Staff College ( UN Partner UN Partner )

![Microlearn Power of Innovation 3 aspect ratio 1920x1080](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/unsdglearn/image/_crop_500_280/Microlearn_Power-of-Innovation-3-aspect-ratio-1920x1080.jpg)

[Visit microlearning page](https://www.unssc.org/news-and-insights/blog/power-innovation-and-design-thinking-implementing-2030-agenda-sustainable/)

Microlearning details
---------------------

Languages

English

Learn more about the power of innovation and how design thinking can support the implementation of the 2030 Agenda.

Topics
------

SDG

2030 Agenda Learning providing a general introduction into the 2030 Agenda and SDG s.

SDG9: Industry, innovation, and infrastructure Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation

SDG17: Partnerships for the goals Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development

SDG 17: Technology

Subject

Design thinking

Keywords

2030 Agenda

design thinking

innovation

SDGs

sustainable development

The notion of design thinking focuses on the human experience. In essence, design thinking is a human-centred systematic approach to problem-solving. When applied in the context of sustainable development, this approach can result in local, collaborative, and participatory initiatives that are founded on the local context rather than being retrofitted to it. Grounded on key thinking paradigms of being holistic, uninhibited, collaborative, iterative, and visual, the design thinking approach fosters integrative and cross-disciplinary thinking.

=======================================================================================================

![Microlearn Power of Innovation 3 aspect ratio 1920x1080](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/unsdglearn/image/_crop_500_280/Microlearn_Power-of-Innovation-3-aspect-ratio-1920x1080.jpg)

[Visit microlearning page](https://www.unssc.org/news-and-insights/blog/power-innovation-and-design-thinking-implementing-2030-agenda-sustainable/)

Microlearning details
---------------------

Languages

English

Learn more about the power of innovation and how design thinking can support the implementation of the 2030 Agenda.

Topics
------

SDG

2030 Agenda Learning providing a general introduction into the 2030 Agenda and SDG s.

SDG9: Industry, innovation, and infrastructure Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation

SDG17: Partnerships for the goals Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development

SDG 17: Technology

Subject

Design thinking

Keywords

2030 Agenda

design thinking

innovation

SDGs

sustainable development

The notion of design thinking focuses on the human experience. In essence, design thinking is a human-centred systematic approach to problem-solving. When applied in the context of sustainable development, this approach can result in local, collaborative, and participatory initiatives that are founded on the local context rather than being retrofitted to it. Grounded on key thinking paradigms of being holistic, uninhibited, collaborative, iterative, and visual, the design thinking approach fosters integrative and cross-disciplinary thinking.

The ITU Digital Skills Forum is the core global event for the ITU membership and other stakeholders to discuss the most pressing needs that must be addressed to ensure that universal digital skills can be achieved, and the global digital skills gap be closed.

Topics
------

SDG

Leave no one behind Learning that focuses on the assessments, identification, engagement, analysis and policies and actions aimed to empower most vulnerable groups and decrease inequalities.

SDG4: Quality education Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all

SDG17: Partnerships for the goals Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development

SDG 17: Capacity-building

Subject

Developing skills for digital transformation

Keywords

digital transformation

digital skills

digital divide

emerging technologies

green transition

The ITU Digital Skills Forum will be held in Manama, Bahrain, from 17 to 19 September 2024.

Under the theme âDeveloping skills for digital transformationâ, the Forum will bring together policy makers, practitioners and experts from around the world. Participants will discuss key pertinent digital skills issues related to bridging the digital divide, the impact of emerging technologies on current and future skills needs, the green and digital transition and skills demand, skills for a safe and secure use of digital technologies, the industry perspective on skills gaps and partnership engagement.

  
  
  

Target Audience
---------------

The event welcomes participants responsible for digital skills and capacity development in relevant ministries, regulatory agencies, telecommunications operating companies, and other national education and learning organizations, as well as representatives from international and regional organizations. Experts interested in the subjects of digital skills and digital transformation are also encouraged to attend.

![RICCAR Arab Climate Change Assessment Report aspect ratio 1920 1080](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/unsdglearn/image/_crop_500_280/RICCAR-Arab-Climate-Change-Assessment-Report-aspect-ratio-1920-1080.jpg)

[Visit resource page](https://www.unescwa.org/publications/riccar-arab-climate-change-assessment-report)

Resource details
----------------

Regions

Western Asia

Languages

English

The Arab Climate Change Assessment Report was prepared within the framework of the Regional Initiative for the Assessment of Climate Change Impacts on Water Resources and Socio-Economic Vulnerability in the Arab Region (RICCAR).

Topics
------

SDG

SDG13: Climate action Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts

Subject

Climate change assessment

Keywords

assessment

climate change

evaluation

The Arab Climate Change Assessment Report was prepared within the framework of the Regional Initiative for the Assessment of Climate Change Impacts on Water Resources and Socio-Economic Vulnerability in the Arab Region (RICCAR). The publication consists of a Main Report and Technical Annex. The Main Report presents a comprehensive picture of the impact that climate change is expected to have on freshwater resources in the Arab region until the end of the century and how this will affect the vulnerability of water resources, agriculture, natural ecosystems, human settlements and people. Case studies findings examining flood frequency, droughts, crop productivity and human health are summarized in the report. These case studies are elaborated in technical reports that complement this main report.

SDG Fitness Test
================

Foundational Assessment

![UN SDG:Learn logo](https://www.unsdglearn.org/img/logo_sdglearn_assessment.svg)

Instructions
------------

UNESCO has defined 8 SDG cross-cutting competencies. They are _Systems thinking,_ _Anticipatory,_ _Normative,_ _Strategic,_ _Collaboration,_ _Critical thinking,_ _Self-awareness, and_ _Integrated problem-solving competencies._ They are "interrelated with each other, transversal, multifunctional, content-independent, and key for achieving the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)". You can find more information about these competencies [here](https://www.unsdglearn.org/unesco-cross-cutting-and-specialized-sdg-competencies/)
.

The assessment consists of 24 questions formulated around 4 scenarios. Each scenario puts a learner in a different role in either government, non-profit, private sector, or as an individual citizen. Each question has 2 correct answers.

_Should you wish to share your comments and suggestions on the assessment, please kindly use this link: [https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/L3M8FT2](https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/L3M8FT2)
_

Changemaker Scan
================

Foundational Assessment

![Ubiquity logo](https://www.unsdglearn.org/img/logo_ubiquity_assessment.svg)

Instructions
------------

How equipped are you to change the world, according to the United Nations?

This self-assessment, developed by Ubiquity University, will help you build your changemaker profile by assessing which of the 8 essential changemaking skills you already have. These are skills that have been identified by the [United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)](https://www.sdglearn.test/unesco-cross-cutting-and-specialized-sdg-competencies)
 as key to reaching the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Identify your strengths, the areas you want to develop and where you could use other people to build a changemaker team.

This self-assessment takes 8-10 minutes.

Instructions
------------

Welcome to the SDG Primer test! This test helps you to do a (self-)assessment of your knowledge of sustainable development and the 2030 Agenda and its SDGs as the overarching framework guiding the UN work on the ground. All questions are based on [the Foundational Primer and the SDG Primer e-course](https://www.sdglearn.test/sdg-primer/)
.

The assessment consists of multiple-choice questions. Each question is a multiple-choice question with four answer choices. Read each question and answer choices carefully and choose the ONE best answer.

There are 15 questions in this section. You need 12 points to pass, and you have a time limit of 45 minutes to complete the test. You will see the time counter on the top part of your screen.

You can retake the test as many times as needed until you get a passing score. You may go back anytime to theÂ Foundational PrimerÂ andÂ SDG Primer E-course to review some of the concepts covered in this test.

Please click the Start button below when you are ready.

Africa
======

[Regional Commission website](https://www.uneca.org)

![Africa 3](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/unsdglearn/image/africa-3.jpg)

Established by the Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) of the United Nations (UN) in 1958 as one of the UN's five regional commissions, ECA's mandate is to promote the economic and social development of its member States, foster intra-regional integration, and promote international cooperation for Africa's development.

This regional section dedicated to the African region and the specific needs of this regionâs countries. The African continent has received a special recognition in the 2030 Agenda and is home to the fastest growing population in the world with a significant portion of young people. African countries have also emphasized the importance of their regional framework Agenda 2063 in addition to implementing the SDGs. The Regional Commission UN ECA operating in this region has the mandate to operate at the regional and subregional levels to harness resources and bring them to bear on Africa's priorities. Its core functions include:

The contribution by ECA to the task of carrying forward the 2030 Agenda and Agenda 2063 is centred on the Commissionâs three core functions, namely, its convening function, its function as a think tank and its operational function, as articulated below:

*   **Convening function:**  
    Providing dedicated regional intergovernmental and multi-stakeholder platforms with strong ownership by member States, regional bodies and development banks that result in agreed development policy frameworks, standards and action plans that reinforce multilateralism at the regional and subregional levels;
*   **Think-tank function:**  
    Conducting multisectoral research and analysis that nurture the integration of the three pillars of sustainable development, and promote peer learning, innovative thinking and the advocacy of public policies while fostering intersectoral linkages and synergies;
*   **Operational function:**  
    Provision of policy advice at the country level through direct demand-based support to member States in areas related to its normative and analytical work and in collaboration with the United Nations system at the country level.

Asia and the Pacific
====================

[Regional Commission website](https://www.unescap.org)

![Asia pacific 3](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/unsdglearn/image/asia-pacific-3.jpg)

The United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (ESCAP) is the regional development arm of the United Nations for the Asia-Pacific region.

ESCAP provides a forum for its member States to promote regional cooperation and collective action in pursuit of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the Sustainable Development Goals, assisting countries to achieve shared economic growth and social equity. In addition, ESCAP gives stronger participation to the smaller and often left out voices of the region, the least developed countries, the small island developing States and landlocked developing States.

ESCAPâs norm setting and policy work ultimately impacts peopleâs lives in a positive way by helping countries shape and implement a more balanced and inclusive development agenda for the region.

The ESCAP secretariat comprises the Office of the Executive Secretary, nine substantive Divisions, the Division of Administration, and the Strategy and Programme Management Division. The delivery of ESCAPâs programmes is supported by the subregional offices and the regional institutions.

The Asia-Pacific region, a home of the two thirds of the worldâs population, including the majority of the global youth, is emerging as the global driver for achieving progress on the 2030 Agenda and the 17 SDGs. Asia-Pacific has evolved into the worldâs production facility for goods, food and services. That has aided Governments of the Asia-Pacific countries to make steady and unaltering progress and achieve accelerated economic growth in the last three decades, which has allowed them to reduce extreme poverty (on less than $1.90 per day) for hundreds of millions of their most disadvantaged people. While economic growth and productivity increases have brought great rewards, they have by no means been evenly distributed and have largely contributed to the regional increase of GHG emissions and the decline of the regionâs limited environmental carrying capacity. The Asia-Pacific faces many unique challenges that both necessitate the achievement of the SDGs and hinder their progress. However, comprehensive understanding of the 2030 Agenda and the 17 SDGs provide the tools to address the current performance challenges for many of the SDGs through genuine and inclusive engagement of all for stakeholders, tapping into the regionâs immense potential and diversity.

Asia and the Pacific
====================

[Regional Commission website](https://www.unescap.org)

![Asia pacific 3](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/unsdglearn/image/asia-pacific-3.jpg)

The United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (ESCAP) is the regional development arm of the United Nations for the Asia-Pacific region.

ESCAP provides a forum for its member States to promote regional cooperation and collective action in pursuit of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the Sustainable Development Goals, assisting countries to achieve shared economic growth and social equity. In addition, ESCAP gives stronger participation to the smaller and often left out voices of the region, the least developed countries, the small island developing States and landlocked developing States.

ESCAPâs norm setting and policy work ultimately impacts peopleâs lives in a positive way by helping countries shape and implement a more balanced and inclusive development agenda for the region.

The ESCAP secretariat comprises the Office of the Executive Secretary, nine substantive Divisions, the Division of Administration, and the Strategy and Programme Management Division. The delivery of ESCAPâs programmes is supported by the subregional offices and the regional institutions.

The Asia-Pacific region, a home of the two thirds of the worldâs population, including the majority of the global youth, is emerging as the global driver for achieving progress on the 2030 Agenda and the 17 SDGs. Asia-Pacific has evolved into the worldâs production facility for goods, food and services. That has aided Governments of the Asia-Pacific countries to make steady and unaltering progress and achieve accelerated economic growth in the last three decades, which has allowed them to reduce extreme poverty (on less than $1.90 per day) for hundreds of millions of their most disadvantaged people. While economic growth and productivity increases have brought great rewards, they have by no means been evenly distributed and have largely contributed to the regional increase of GHG emissions and the decline of the regionâs limited environmental carrying capacity. The Asia-Pacific faces many unique challenges that both necessitate the achievement of the SDGs and hinder their progress. However, comprehensive understanding of the 2030 Agenda and the 17 SDGs provide the tools to address the current performance challenges for many of the SDGs through genuine and inclusive engagement of all for stakeholders, tapping into the regionâs immense potential and diversity.

Europe and North America
========================

[Regional Commission website](https://www.unece.org)

![Europe 3](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/unsdglearn/image/europe-3.jpg)

UNECE's major aim is to promote pan-European economic integration. UNECE includes 56 member States in Europe, North America and Asia.

This regional section dedicated to the North American and European region goes beyond the geographic boundaries of the two continents and encompasses learning resources and capacity development initiatives that can be helpful to any country from among the [56 member States](http://www.unece.org/oes/nutshell/member_States_representatives.html)
 of the UN Economic Commission for Europe situated in Europe, North America and Asia. UNECE itself supports countries in the implementation of the 2030 Agenda and the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) thanks to its:

*   Role as a platform for governments to cooperate and engage with all stakeholders on norms, standards and conventions;
*   Unique convening power across the region;
*   Multisectoral approach to tackle the interconnected challenges of sustainable development in an integrated manner;
*   Transboundary focus, which helps devise solutions to shared challenges;
*   Partnerships (SDG 17) between stakeholders including governments, international and regional organizations, businesses, academia and civil society are a driving force of UNECEâs work.

This covers three main strategic areas:

*   Improving connectivity within the region (SDGs, 7, 8, 9, 11, 13);
*   Reducing environmental pressures and using resources more sustainably (SDGs 3, 6, 7, 12, 13, 15);
*   Contributing to creating more dynamic and resilient economies (SDGs 7, 8, 9, 11, 13).

[Regional Commission website](https://www.cepal.org)

![45179535705 ddfa3af103 o](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/unsdglearn/image/45179535705_ddfa3af103_o.jpg)

The Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean (ECLAC) - the Spanish acronym is CEPAL- was established by Economic and Social Council resolution 106(VI) of 25 February 1948 and began to function that same year.

The Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean (ECLAC) is one of five regional commissions of the United Nations headquartered in Santiago, Chile. It was founded in 1948 with the purpose of contributing to the economic and social development of Latin America, coordinating actions directed towards this end, and reinforcing economic ties among countries and with other nations of the world.

ECLAC contributes to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, through analytical and policy support on economic, social and environmental issues related to the 2030 Agenda and through customized capacity -building and technical advice activities by demand of its member States. Poverty eradication and the reduction of inequalities are central elements of the SDGs, and are key priorities for Latin America and the Caribbean and thus central to ECLACâs research agenda and activities.

Training is an integral part of the technical cooperation that ECLAC offers its member countries, along with its interdisciplinary expertise and intergovernmental and multi-stakeholder regional platforms to support the fulfillment of this ambitious agenda in the region.

Western Asia
============

[Regional Commission website](https://www.unescwa.org)

![Photocomp3](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/unsdglearn/image/photocomp3.gif)

UNESCWA is one of the five regional commissions were created by the United Nations in order to fulfil the economic and social goals set out in the Charter by promoting cooperation and integration between countries in each region of the world.

UNESCWA provides a framework for the formulation and harmonization of sectoral policies for its 18 Arab member countries, a platform for congress and coordination, a home for expertise and knowledge, and an information observatory. Its activities are coordinated with the divisions and main offices of the Headquarters of the United Nations, specialized agencies, and international and regional organizations, including the League of Arab States and its subsidiary bodies, and the Gulf Cooperation Council.

the main objectives of UNESCWA is to: (a) support economic and social development in member countries, (b) promote interaction and cooperation between member countries, (c) encourage the exchange of experience, best practice and lessons learned, (d) achieve regional integration and ensure interaction with other regions, and (e) raise global awareness of the circumstances and needs of member countries.

About Us
========

UN SDG:Learn is a United Nations initiative that aims to bring relevant and curated learning solutions on sustainable development topics to individuals and organizations.

Through the collaborative efforts of the United Nations, multilateral organizations, and sustainable development partners from universities, civil society, academia and the private sector, UN SDG:Learn provides a unique gateway that empowers individuals and organizations through an informed decision when selecting among a wealth of SDG-related learning products and services that are currently available.

UN SDG:Learn: Main Components
-----------------------------

UN SDG:Learn consists of three main components: The Platform; The Partnership; The Programme.

![](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/unsdglearn/UN-SDG-Learn-wheel-1.jpg)

![The Programme icon](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/unsdglearn/about_icon_01_110.jpg)

### The Platform

The web-based Platform is a gateway that matches learnersu2019 needs with learning solutions offered by UN SDG: Learn Partner organizations targeting diverse audiences from government officials, UN staff, private sector executives and employees, parliamentarians, NGO workers, young people, journalists and citizens at large. The Platform enables a smart navigation through the growing wealth of various learning solutions including courses, tutorials, podcasts, analytical and other tools, and the expertise on topics related to SDG achievement.

![The Partnership icon](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/unsdglearn/about_icon_02_110.jpg)

### The Partnership

The Partnership ensures that the Platform becomes a key resource and the main gateway for SDG learning. UN SDG:Learn is powered by a community of practitioners that bring together the main providers of learning solutions on the SDGs from the UN, academia and universities and the private sector. The Partners network engages in regular exchange on learning methodologies, tools, curricula, and courses relevant for SDG learning.

![The Platform icon](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/unsdglearn/about_icon_03_110.jpg)

### The Programme

The Programme will feature and offer joint learning initiatives that will be co-designed as part of the UN SDG: Learn Partnership to ensure integrated learning support to countries.

UN SDG:Learn is ultimately about allowing the UN family to work in collaboration with key partners and reach out to millions of people whose professional and personal learning choices will make a difference if we are to achieve the SDGs.

Partners
========

![CNMOOC](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/CNMOOC_1.jpg)

[CNMOOC](https://www.cnmooc.org/home/index.mooc)

-------------------------------------------------

CNMOOC

"CNMOOC" ââ is the official website of China High-level University MOOC Alliance. The alliance is an open cooperative education platform voluntarily established among some high-level universities in China.

![Data-Pop Alliance](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/dpa-3.png)

[Data-Pop Alliance](https://datapopalliance.org)

-------------------------------------------------

DPA

Data-Pop Alliance is a global coalition on Big Data and development comopsed of the Harvard Humanitarian Initiative, MIT Media Lab, Overseas Development Institute and Flowminder Foundation.

![Deloitte](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/Deloitte-logo.jpg)

[Deloitte](https://www2.deloitte.com)

--------------------------------------

Deloitte

Deloitte offers integrated services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. Their approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with business and industry knowledge to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.

![Environmental Systems Research Institute](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/esri-3.jpg)

[Environmental Systems Research Institute](https://www.esri.com/en-us/industries/sustainability/segments/sustainable-development)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ESRI

Geographic Information System Provider pioneering problem solving with GIS and supporting the usersâ important work with a commitment to science, sustainability, community, education, research, and positive change.

![European Organization for Nuclear Research](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/logos/LogoOutline-Blue.gif)

[European Organization for Nuclear Research](https://home.cern/)

-----------------------------------------------------------------

CERN

CERN mission is to help uncover what the universe is made of and how it works, by providing a unique range of particle accelerator facilities that enable research at the forefront of human knowledge, performing world-class research in fundamental physics, and uniting people from all over the world to push the frontiers of science and technology, for the benefit of all.

![Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS)](https://www.unsdglearn.org/about-us/partners/EGRISS)

[Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS)](https://egrisstats.org/)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EGRISS

The Expert Group on Refugee, Internally Displaced Persons, and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS) is a multi-stakeholder group mandated by the UN Statistical Commission to develop international recommendations, standards, and guidance for improved forced displacement and statelessness statistics.

![Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/FAO.jpg)

[Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations](http://www.fao.org/home/en/)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FAO

The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations that leads international efforts to defeat hunger. Its goal is to achieve food security for all.

![German Development Institute](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/DIE-logo.jpg)

[German Development Institute](https://www.die-gdi.de/en/)

-----------------------------------------------------------

GDI

The German Development Institute / Deutsches Institut fÃ¼r Entwicklungspolitik (DIE) is one of the leading think tanks for global development and international cooperation worldwide.

![Global Network of Institutions for Statistical Training](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/gist-title-logo.jpg)

[Global Network of Institutions for Statistical Training](https://unstats.un.org/GIST)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GIST

Global Network of Institutions for Statistical Training (GIST) is a network of international and regional training institutions, working together build sustainable statistical capacities through efficient, effective, and harmonized delivery of training.

![Global Reporting Initiative](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/GRI-logo.png)

[Global Reporting Initiative](https://www.globalreporting.org/)

----------------------------------------------------------------

GRI

GRI is an independent international organization that has pioneered sustainability reporting since 1997.

![Green Growth Knowledge Platform](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/GGKP-logo.jpg)

[Green Growth Knowledge Platform](https://www.greengrowthknowledge.org/)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

GGKP

The GGKP is a global community of organisations and experts committed to collaboratively generating, managing and sharing green growth knowledge and data to mobilise a sustainable future.

![IE School of Global and Public Affairs](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/ie-3.jpg)

[IE School of Global and Public Affairs](https://www.ie.edu/school-global-public-affairs/)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

IEGPA

The IE School of Global and Public Affairs is a leading educational and research institution, which trains students to excel in careers in the international public, private and non-profit sectors by applying theory to current global affairs issues.

![International Fund for Agricultural Development](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/ifad_600x600.jpg)

[International Fund for Agricultural Development](https://www.ifad.org/en/)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

IFAD

IFAD is an international financial institution and specialized United Nations agency based in Rome, the UNâs food and agriculture hub. Since 1978, we have provided US$28 billion in grants and low-interest loans to projects that have reached about 483 million people.

![International Institute for Sustainable Development](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/iisd-3.png)

[International Institute for Sustainable Development](https://www.iisd.org/)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

IISD

The International Institute for Sustainable Development (IISD) is an independent think tank championing sustainable solutions to 21st century problems.

![International Labour Organization](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/ILO_logo_600x600.jpg)

[International Labour Organization](https://www.ilo.org/global/about-the-ilo/lang--en/index.htm)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ILO

The ILO was founded in 1919, in the wake of a destructive war, to pursue a vision based on the premise that universal, lasting peace can be established only if it is based on social justice. The ILO became the first specialized agency of the UN in 1946.

![International Monetary Fund](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/IMF-logo_jpeg.jpg)

[International Monetary Fund](https://www.imf.org/external/index.htm)

----------------------------------------------------------------------

IMF

The International Monetary Fund (IMF) is an international organization of 189 countries, working to foster sustainable economic growth. The IMF supports its members by providing: policy advice to governments and central banks; research, statistics, forecasts, and analysis; loans; and technical assistance and training to officials to help countries improve the management of their economies.

![International Organisation of Employers](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/IOE.jpg)

[International Organisation of Employers](https://www.ioe-emp.org/)

--------------------------------------------------------------------

IOE

The IOE is the largest network of the private sector in the world, with more than 150 business and employer organisation members.

![International Organization for Migration](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/OIM_logo_1_600x600.jpg)

[International Organization for Migration](https://www.iom.int/)

-----------------------------------------------------------------

IOM

Established in 1951, IOM is the leading inter-governmental organization in the field of migration and works closely with governmental, intergovernmental and non-governmental partners.

![International Telecommunication Union](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/ITU_official_logo-blue_600x600.png)

[International Telecommunication Union](https://www.itu.int/en/Pages/default.aspx)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ITU

âââââââââââââââââââââITU is the UN specialized agency for information and communication technologies â ICTs. Founded in 1865 to facilitate international connectivity in communications networks. ITU is committed to connecting all the world's people â wherever they live and whatever their means.

![International Trade Centre](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/itc_1_600x600.jpg)

[International Trade Centre](http://www.intracen.org/)

-------------------------------------------------------

ITC

ITC is the joint agency of the World Trade Organization and UN. ITC is the only multilateral agency fully dedicated to supporting the internationalisation of SMEs. Its joint mandate combines a focus on expanding trade opportunities with the aim of fostering sustanable development.

![Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNAIDS_logo_600x600.jpg)

[Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS](https://www.unaids.org/en)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNAIDS

UNAIDS is leading the global effort to end AIDS by 2030 as part of the SDGs. We provide strategic direction, advocacy, coordination and technical support to catalyse and connect leadership from governments, the private sector and communities to deliver life-saving HIV services.

![Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/LKYSPP.jpg)

[Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy](https://lkyspp.nus.edu.sg/)

-------------------------------------------------------------------

LKYSPP

As a part of the National University of Singapore, the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy educates and trains the next generation of Asian policy-makers and leaders.

![Leeds Beckett University: School of the Built Environment, Engineering and Computing](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/lbu2.png)

[Leeds Beckett University: School of the Built Environment, Engineering and Computing](https://www.leedsbeckett.ac.uk/school-of-built-environment-engineering-and-computing/)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

LBU: BEEC

Leeds Beckett University is committed to being an excellent, accessible, and globally engaged university, contributing positively to a thriving economy in northern UK and beyond. Through excellent education provision, research and services, LBU, aims to make a positive and decisive difference to people, organisations and communities.

![McKinsey & Company](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/McKinsey-logo.jpg)

[McKinsey & Company](https://www.mckinsey.com/)

------------------------------------------------

McKinsey

McKinsey & Company is the trusted advisor and counselor to many of the world's most influential businesses and institutions.

![Millennium Institute](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/mi-3.jpg)

[Millennium Institute](https://www.millennium-institute.org/)

--------------------------------------------------------------

MI

Millennium Institute (MI) is a nonprofit organization passionate about improving the welfare of individuals by helping decision makers apply systems thinking to achieve sustainable development.

![MOON-CN Information Technology](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/xuetangx-3.png)

[MOON-CN Information Technology](http://www.xuetangx.com)

----------------------------------------------------------

XuetangX

Founded by Tsinghua University in October 2013, XuetangX is the world's first Chinese MOOC platform and serves as the research and application platform for the Ministry of Education (MOE) Research Center for Online Education.

![PwC Norway](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/PwC-Norway-logo.jpg)

[PwC Norway](https://www.pwc.no/en.html)

-----------------------------------------

PwC Norway

PwC is the largest network of accountants, lawyers and advisors worldwide, and deliver services within audit, consulting and tax.

![Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/RSM-square-600x600.jpg)

[Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University](http://www.rsm.nl)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

RSM Erasmus

Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University (RSM) is one of Europeâs top 10 business schools. RSM provides ground-breaking research and education furthering excellence in all aspects of management. RSMâs primary focus is on developing business leaders (with international careers) who can become a force for positive change by carrying their innovative mindset into a sustainable future.

![Stockholm Environment Institute](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/SEI-logo.jpg)

[Stockholm Environment Institute](https://www.sei.org/)

--------------------------------------------------------

SEI

Stockholm Environment Institute is an international non-profit research and policy organization that tackles environment and development challenges.

![Teach the Future](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/Teach-the-future-600-x-600.png)

[Teach the Future](https://www.teachthefuture.org)

---------------------------------------------------

TTF

Teach the Future is a global movement that promotes futures literacy for students and educators. Our aspiration is: Every student should be prepared to navigate an uncertain world and have the agency to imagine and create their preferred future. Our mission is: Teach futures-thinking (soft-) skills to students and educators around the world to inspire them to influence their futures.

![The Association of Commonwealth Universities](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/ACU-logo.jpg)

[The Association of Commonwealth Universities](https://www.acu.ac.uk/)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

ACU

The ACU is an international organisation dedicated to building a better world through higher education. International collaboration is central to this ambition: by bringing universities together from around the world â and crucially the people who study and work within them â the ACU helps to advance knowledge, promote understanding, broaden minds, and improve lives.

![The Sustainability Literacy Test](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/sulitest-3.jpg)

[The Sustainability Literacy Test](https://www.sulitest.org)

-------------------------------------------------------------

SULITEST

Sulitest is a movement whose mission is to support expanded sustainability knowledge, skills and mindset that motivates individuals to become deeply committed to building a sustainable future.

![Ubiquity University](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/ubiquity_logo_600x600.jpg)

[Ubiquity University](https://www.ubiquityuniversity.org)

----------------------------------------------------------

Ubiquity

Ubiquity University is an accredited global university designed for social impact. We believe that people everywhere must be supported with the soft and hard skills they need to solve pressing global problems that are threatening the planetary ecology and human society. We offer online and in-person competency-based learning and a global online community for positive changemakers we call UbiVerse.

![UN CC:Learn](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/uncclearn.jpg)

[UN CC:Learn](https://www.uncclearn.org/)

------------------------------------------

UN CC:Learn

The One UN Climate Change Learning Partnership (UN CC:Learn) is a collaborative initiative of more than 30 multilateral organizations supporting countries to design and implement systematic, recurrent and results-oriented climate change learning. The initiative was launched at the 2009 Copenhagen Climate Change Summit.

![UN Committee of Experts on Big Data and Data Science for Official Statistics](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/logo_2021_long_2023-08-04-210330_iaui.png)

[UN Committee of Experts on Big Data and Data Science for Official Statistics](https://unstats.un.org/bigdata/index.cshtml)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNCEBD

![UN Office at Geneva](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNOG-logo.jpg)

[UN Office at Geneva](https://www.unog.ch/)

--------------------------------------------

UNOG

Housed at the Palais des Nations, the United Nations Office at Geneva (UNOG) serves as the representative office of the Secretary-General at Geneva.

![UN Office for Disaster Risk Reduction](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNDRR_logo_600x600.jpg)

[UN Office for Disaster Risk Reduction](http://www.undrr.org)

[Millennium Institute](https://www.millennium-institute.org/)

--------------------------------------------------------------

MI

Millennium Institute (MI) is a nonprofit organization passionate about improving the welfare of individuals by helping decision makers apply systems thinking to achieve sustainable development.

![MOON-CN Information Technology](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/xuetangx-3.png)

[MOON-CN Information Technology](http://www.xuetangx.com)

----------------------------------------------------------

XuetangX

Founded by Tsinghua University in October 2013, XuetangX is the world's first Chinese MOOC platform and serves as the research and application platform for the Ministry of Education (MOE) Research Center for Online Education.

![PwC Norway](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/PwC-Norway-logo.jpg)

[PwC Norway](https://www.pwc.no/en.html)

-----------------------------------------

PwC Norway

PwC is the largest network of accountants, lawyers and advisors worldwide, and deliver services within audit, consulting and tax.

![Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/RSM-square-600x600.jpg)

[Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University](http://www.rsm.nl)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

RSM Erasmus

Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University (RSM) is one of Europeâs top 10 business schools. RSM provides ground-breaking research and education furthering excellence in all aspects of management. RSMâs primary focus is on developing business leaders (with international careers) who can become a force for positive change by carrying their innovative mindset into a sustainable future.

![Stockholm Environment Institute](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/SEI-logo.jpg)

[Stockholm Environment Institute](https://www.sei.org/)

--------------------------------------------------------

SEI

Stockholm Environment Institute is an international non-profit research and policy organization that tackles environment and development challenges.

![Teach the Future](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/Teach-the-future-600-x-600.png)

[Teach the Future](https://www.teachthefuture.org)

---------------------------------------------------

TTF

Teach the Future is a global movement that promotes futures literacy for students and educators. Our aspiration is: Every student should be prepared to navigate an uncertain world and have the agency to imagine and create their preferred future. Our mission is: Teach futures-thinking (soft-) skills to students and educators around the world to inspire them to influence their futures.

![The Association of Commonwealth Universities](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/ACU-logo.jpg)

[The Association of Commonwealth Universities](https://www.acu.ac.uk/)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

ACU

The ACU is an international organisation dedicated to building a better world through higher education. International collaboration is central to this ambition: by bringing universities together from around the world â and crucially the people who study and work within them â the ACU helps to advance knowledge, promote understanding, broaden minds, and improve lives.

![The Sustainability Literacy Test](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/sulitest-3.jpg)

[The Sustainability Literacy Test](https://www.sulitest.org)

-------------------------------------------------------------

SULITEST

Sulitest is a movement whose mission is to support expanded sustainability knowledge, skills and mindset that motivates individuals to become deeply committed to building a sustainable future.

![Ubiquity University](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/ubiquity_logo_600x600.jpg)

[Ubiquity University](https://www.ubiquityuniversity.org)

----------------------------------------------------------

Ubiquity

Ubiquity University is an accredited global university designed for social impact. We believe that people everywhere must be supported with the soft and hard skills they need to solve pressing global problems that are threatening the planetary ecology and human society. We offer online and in-person competency-based learning and a global online community for positive changemakers we call UbiVerse.

![UN CC:Learn](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/uncclearn.jpg)

[UN CC:Learn](https://www.uncclearn.org/)

------------------------------------------

UN CC:Learn

The One UN Climate Change Learning Partnership (UN CC:Learn) is a collaborative initiative of more than 30 multilateral organizations supporting countries to design and implement systematic, recurrent and results-oriented climate change learning. The initiative was launched at the 2009 Copenhagen Climate Change Summit.

![UN Committee of Experts on Big Data and Data Science for Official Statistics](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/logo_2021_long_2023-08-04-210330_iaui.png)

[UN Committee of Experts on Big Data and Data Science for Official Statistics](https://unstats.un.org/bigdata/index.cshtml)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNCEBD

![UN Office at Geneva](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNOG-logo.jpg)

[UN Office at Geneva](https://www.unog.ch/)

--------------------------------------------

UNOG

Housed at the Palais des Nations, the United Nations Office at Geneva (UNOG) serves as the representative office of the Secretary-General at Geneva.

![UN Office for Disaster Risk Reduction](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNDRR_logo_600x600.jpg)

[UN Office for Disaster Risk Reduction](http://www.undrr.org)

--------------------------------------------------------------

UNDRR

UNDRR works towards the substantial reduction of disaster risk and losses to ensure a sustainable future. UNDRR (formerly known as UNISDR) is the focal point of the UN system for disaster risk reduction and the custodian of the Sendai Framework.

![United Nations Children's Fund](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/unicef_logo_600x600px.jpg)

[United Nations Children's Fund](https://www.unicef.org/)

----------------------------------------------------------

UNICEF

UNICEF works in over 190 countries and territories to save childrenâs lives, to defend their rights, and to help them fulfil their potential, from early childhood through adolescence. And we never give up.

![United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/DESA-new-logo.jpg)

[United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs](https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UN DESA

Rooted in the UN Charter and guided by the transformative 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, the UN Department of Economic and Social Affairs (UN DESA) upholds the development pillar of the United Nations.

![United Nations Development Coordination Office](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/DCO-new-logo.jpg)

[United Nations Development Coordination Office](https://www.un.org/en/)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNDCO

Newly transformed UN Development Coordination Office (DOCO) which was previously under the leadership of the UN Development Group (UNDG) Chair and guidance of the UNDG.

![United Nations Development Programme](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNDP-logo.jpg)

[United Nations Development Programme](https://www.undp.org/)

--------------------------------------------------------------

UNDP

UNDP works to eradicate poverty and reduce inequalities through the sustainable development of nations, in more than 170 countries and territories.

![United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/escap-3.png)

[United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific](https://www.unescap.org/)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ESCAP

ESCAP, one of the 5 Regional Commissions that serves as the UN's regional hub promoting cooperation among 53 member States to achieve inclusive and sustainable development.

![United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/escwa-3.jpg)

[United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia](https://www.unescwa.org/)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNESCWA

UNESCWA is one of the 5 UN regional commissions created in order to fulfil the economic and social goals set out in the UN Charter by promoting cooperation and integration between the 18 Arab memebr countries.

![United Nations Economic Commission for Africa](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/uneca-logo.jpg)

[United Nations Economic Commission for Africa](https://www.uneca.org/)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

UN ECA

Established by the Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) of the United Nations (UN) in 1958 as one of the UN's five regional commissions, ECA's mandate is to promote the economic and social development of its member States, foster intra-regional integration, and promote international cooperation for Africa's development.

![United Nations Economic Commission for Europe](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/unece-3.jpg)

[United Nations Economic Commission for Europe](https://www.unece.org)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

UNECE

UNECE, one of 5 regional commissions, facilitates greater economic integration and cooperation among its 56 member States and promotes sustainable development.

![United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America  and the Caribbean](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/download_1_-_Mareike_Eberz_600x600.png)

[United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean](https://www.cepal.org/en)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ECLAC

ECLAC, which is headquartered in Santiago, Chile, is one of the five regional commissions of the United Nations. It was founded with the purpose of contributing to the economic development of Latin America, coordinating actions directed towards this end, and reinforcing economic ties among countries and with other nations of the world.

![United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNESCO-logo.jpg)

[United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization](https://en.unesco.org/)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNESCO

UNESCO is the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization. It seeks to build peace through international cooperation in Education, the Sciences and Culture. UNESCO's programmes contribute to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals defined in Agenda 2030, adopted by the UN General Assembly in 2015.

![United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/unw-3.png)

[United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women](http://www.unwomen.org)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UN Women

UN Women is the global champion for gender equality, working to develop and uphold standards and create an environment in which every woman and girl can exercise her human rights and live up to her full potential.

![United Nations Environment Programme](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/unep-logo.jpg)

[United Nations Environment Programme](https://www.unep.org/)

--------------------------------------------------------------

UNEP

Since its inception in 1972,Â the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) has been the global authority that sets the environmental agenda,Â promotes the coherent implementation of the environmental dimension of sustainable development within theÂ UN systemÂ and serves as an authoritative advocate for the global environment.

![United Nations Environment Programme](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/unep.jpg)

[United Nations Environment Programme](https://www.unenvironment.org/)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

UNEP

The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) is the leading global environmental authority that sets the global environmental agenda, promotes the coherent implementation of the environmental dimension of sustainable development within the United Nations system, and serves as an authoritative advocate for the global environment.

![United Nations Evaluation Group](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/thumbnail_UNEG-Logo-Square.jpg)

[United Nations Evaluation Group](http://www.unevaluation.org/about)

---------------------------------------------------------------------

UNEG

The United Nations Evaluation Group (UNEG) is an interagency professional network that brings together the evaluation units of the UN system, including UN departments, specialized agencies, funds and programmes, and affiliated organizations. It currently has 50 such members and observers

![United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNFCCC-logo.jpg)

[United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change](https://unfccc.int/)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNFCCC

The UNFCCC secretariat (UN Climate Change) is the UN entity tasked with supporting the global response to the threat of climate change.

![United Nations Global Compact](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/ungc-3.jpg)

[United Nations Global Compact](https://www.unglobalcompact.org/)

------------------------------------------------------------------

UNGC

As a special initiative of the UN Secretary-General, the UN Global Compact is a call to companies everywhere to align their operations with ten universally accepted principles in support of UN goals.

![United Nations Industrial Development Organization](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/unido-3.jpg)

[United Nations Industrial Development Organization](https://www.unido.org/)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNIDO

UNIDO is a specialized agency of the United Nations on industrial development. UNIDO's mandate is to promote and accelerate inclusive and sustainable industrial development.

![United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNIDIR.jpg)

[United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research](http://www.unidir.ch/)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNIDIR

Operating since 1980, the United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research (UNIDIR) is an autonomous institution within the United Nations that conducts independent research on disarmament and related problems, particularly international security issues.

![United Nations Institute for Training and Research](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNITAR-logo-new.jpg)

[United Nations Institute for Training and Research](https://www.unitar.org)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNITAR

The United Nations Institute for Training and Research (UNITAR) provides innovative learning solutions to individuals, organizations and institutions to enhance global decision-making and support country-level action for shaping a better future.

![United Nations Interregional Crime and Justice Research Institute](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNICRI_logo_600x600.jpg)

[United Nations Interregional Crime and Justice Research Institute](http://www.unicri.it/)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNICRI

The United Nations Interregional Crime and Justice Research Institute (UNICRI) was established in 1968 pursuant to Economic and Social Council Resolution 1086 B (XXXIX) of 1965, which urged an expansion of the United Nations activities in crime prevention and criminal justice.

![United Nations Office for Partnerships](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/unop-3.jpg)

[United Nations Office for Partnerships](https://www.un.org/partnerships/)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNOP

The United Nations Office for Partnerships serves as a global gateway for public-private partnerships to advance the implementation of the 2030 Agenda.

![United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/unodc-3.jpg)

[United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime](https://www.unodc.org/)

-------------------------------------------------------------------

UNODC

UNODC is a global leader in the fight against illicit drugs and international crime that operates in all regions of the world through an extensive network of field offices.

![United Nations Research Institute for Social Development](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/unrisd-3.jpg)

[United Nations Research Institute for Social Development](http://www.unrisd.org/)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UNRISD

UNRISD works with its global networks to undertake interdisciplinary research and policy analysis, and position social equity, inclusion and justice at the centre of development thinking, policy and practice.

![United Nations Sustainable Development Solutions Network](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNSDSN-logo.jpg)

[United Nations Sustainable Development Solutions Network](https://www.unsdsn.org/about-us)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SDSN

The UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network (SDSN) was set up in 2012 under the auspices of the UN Secretary-General. SDSN mobilizes global scientific and technological expertise to promote practical solutions for sustainable development, including the implementation of the SDGs and the Paris Climate Agreement.

![United Nations System Staff College](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/Untitled-design.png)

[United Nations System Staff College](https://www.unssc.org)

-------------------------------------------------------------

UNSSC

The United Nations System Staff College (UNSSC) is the primary provider of interagency training and learning for staff of the United Nations system.

![United Nations University](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/Logo-UNU-600x600.jpg)

[United Nations University](https://unu.edu/)

----------------------------------------------

UNU

UNU is a global think tank and postgraduate teaching organisation. Its mission is to contribute, through collaborative research and education, to efforts to resolve the pressing global problems of human survival, development and welfare that are the concern of UN, its Peoples, and Member States.

![UniversitÃ© de GenÃ¨ve](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/unige-3.jpg)

[UniversitÃ© de GenÃ¨ve](https://www.unige.ch/)

----------------------------------------------

UNIGE

Founded in 1559 by Jean Calvin, the University of Geneva is dedicated to teaching, research and dialogue with society. With more than 17'000 students of some 150 different nationalities, it is Switzerland's second largest university.

![University of Gloucestershire](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UniofGlos-Square-Logo.jpg)

[University of Gloucestershire](https://www.glos.ac.uk/)

---------------------------------------------------------

UOG

The University of Gloucestershire is a diverse, vibrant community of 12,000 students and 1,500 staff, based across campuses in Cheltenham and Gloucester in the UK. The University offers its students a specialised and dynamic place to learn, grow and make lasting connections. UOG prides itself on serving the wider community through promoting its economic, cultural and social wellbeing.

![World Bank Group](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/WB_logo_1.jpg)

[World Bank Group](https://www.worldbank.org/)

-----------------------------------------------

WBG

The World Bank Group (WBG) is a multilateral organization headquartered in Washington, D.C., whose members include most of the worldâs countries. Five institutions make up the WBG to collectively serve as a vital source of financial and technical assistance to developing countries. We have set two goals that will shape our work through 2030: ending extreme poverty and promoting shared prosperity.

![World Economic Forum](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/SI_logo.jpg)

[World Economic Forum](https://intelligence.weforum.org/)

----------------------------------------------------------

WEF

The World Economic Forum is the International Organization for Public-Private Cooperation. The Forum engages the foremost political, business, cultural and other leaders of society to shape global, regional and industry agendas. It was established in 1971 as a not-for-profit foundation and is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland. It is independent, impartial and not tied to any special interests

![World Food Programme](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/WFP-Logo.png)

[World Food Programme](http://www.wfp.org/)

--------------------------------------------

WFP

The World Food Programme is the worldâs largest humanitarian organization saving lives in emergencies and using food assistance to build a pathway to peace, stability and prosperity, for people recovering from conflict, disasters and the impact of climate change.

![World Intellectual Property Organization](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/WIPO_logo_600x600.jpg)

[World Intellectual Property Organization](https://www.wipo.int/portal/en/index.html)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WIPO

WIPO is the global forum for intellectual property (IP) services, policy, information and cooperation. It is a self-funding agency of the United Nations, with 192 member states. WIPO'smission is to lead the development of a balanced and effective international IP system that enables innovation and creativity for the benefit of all.

![World Tourism Organization](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/UNWTO_600x600.jpg)

[World Tourism Organization](https://unwto.org)

------------------------------------------------

UNWTO

The World Tourism Organization (UNWTO) is the United Nations agency responsible for the promotion of responsible, sustainable and universally accessible tourism.

![World Trade Organisation](https://www.unsdglearn.org/files/transforms/logos/_fit_200_200/wto-3.jpg)

[World Trade Organisation](https://www.wto.org)

------------------------------------------------

WTO

The Institute for Training and Technical Cooperation coordinates the WTO's technical assistance and training addressing countries' trade capacity, trade policy issues and integrating into multilateral trading system.

**Full policy**
---------------

**Privacy Policy of the UN SDG:Learn platform**

The present Privacy Policy along with the Terms and Conditions of Use constitute an âAgreementâ between the user and the UN SDG:Learn regarding the use of any portion of the UN SDG:Learn platform which consists of all content located within the unsdglearn.org web domain, including featured courses and microlearning, resources, events, blogs, podcasts, assessments or any other services (learning products and solutions).

By registering on the UN SDG:Learn platform, Users hereby confirm their awareness and acceptance of the present Privacy Policy and the Terms and Conditions of Use, as well as any changes or modifications to the Privacy Policy or Terms and Conditions of Use that may from time to time be implemented.

The purpose of this Privacy Policy is to explain how UN SDG:Learn collects, uses and shares information about Users through the UN SDG:Learn platform [www.unsdglearn.org](http://www.unsdglearn.org)
) and respective featured content and assessments.

**Personal Information**

Personal information is information which Users provide to UN SDG:Learn which personally identifies them, such as name, email address or other data which can be reasonably linked to them. This information is requested upon registration on the UN SDG:Learn, and can also potentially be provided when filling out feedback forms or sending an email.

**Collection of Information**

Data collected on the UN SDG:Learn can be data provided by the User, i.e. upon registration, feedback form, emails, etc. OR data collected through the use of UN SDG:Learn services, i.e. selected areas of interest, mental models, assessment results, and learning pathways.

The following data1 is collected through the use of UN SDG:Learn services for the purpose of learning analytics. Data collected will depend on the services offered and selected by the User, which may include:

1.  Registration data;
2.  Selected areas of interest around SDGs, cross-cutting themes and mental models;
3.  User assessments results;
4.  Anonymized user behaviour and statistics.

Personal information of Users may be transferred to the United Nations Institute for Training and Research (UNITAR) and the United Nations System Staff College (UNSSC), which serve as the UN SDG:Learn Joint Secretariat. Once transferred to UNITAR and UNSSC, personal information will be processed by UNITAR in accordance with its [Data Protection and Privacy Policy](https://www.unitar.org/event/data-protection-and-privacy-policy)
 and by UNSSC in accordance with its [Privacy Policy](https://www.unssc.org/privacy)
. The personal information of Users also may be transferred to the custodian agencies of UN SDG:Learn community sites, where it will be processed according to their respective privacy and data protection policies.

No individual learning analytics will be knowingly made available to other people outside UN SDG:Learn unless specified and separate consent from users is obtained.

**Use of Information**

Personal information is collected and used for the following purposes:

1.  to provide, maintain, protect and improve the quality of the UN SDG:Learn, UN SDG:Learn and all its services; this includes the research purposes and implementation of quality assurance processes. The information is used without personal identification;
2.  to provide Users with personalised feedback;
3.  to send email notifications and updates about overall UN SDG:Learn, and services;
4.  to manage User account(s).

**Security of Information**

Privacy of User information is of utmost priority for UN SDG:Learn. Procedural and technological measures are in place to protect User Personal Information. Such procedures protect the confidentiality of the Personal Information or User traffic that UN SDG:Learn creates, receives, stores and transmits.

UN SDG:Learn has done all in its power to ensure that the Company providing the Hosting Services for UN SDG:Learn has put in place all the requisite technical and organisational security measures to prevent unauthorised access to Usersâ personal information.

UN SDG:Learn protects all stored data from misuse and respects the rights of the data owners which are guaranteed by ensuring that the access, analyse or otherwise the purpose of use of information is consistent with our mandate.

UN SDG:Learn may disclose your Personal Information only:

1.  if required to do so by law, regulation or other government authority or otherwise in cooperation with an investigation of a governmental authority;
2.  to enforce the UN SDG:Learn Terms and Conditions of Use;
3.  to protect the safety of users of the UN SDG:Learn and its services.

**Changes in the Privacy Policy**

The Privacy Policy is subject to change and modification. Any change, update, or modification will be effective immediately upon posting on our website. Any material change to this Privacy Policy will be made known by changing the effective date (located at the bottom of this page). This page should be reviewed periodically to ensure Users are up to date with the most current version of this Privacy Policy.
